articles.title: 2 winning $1 million Powerball tickets sold in Southern California - KTLA
articles.description: Two lucky Southern Californians have won over $1 million after numbers were drawn for the Powerball jackpot on Saturday night. Although no winner hit all six numbers for the $1 billion jackpot, four tickets matched five numbers and will take home $1,165,399. …

articles.title: No. 9 LSU outlasts No. 4 Clemson as Garrett Nussmeier outduels Cade Klubnik in top-10 showdown - CBS Sports
articles.description: Brian Kelly and LSU were finally able to shake the season-opening woes with a marquee win on Saturday night

articles.title: Israeli strike killed Houthi prime minister Ahmad al-Rahawi, group says - The Washington Post
articles.description: Prime Minister Ahmad al-Rahawi and several ministers were killed in an Israeli strike Thursday on Sanaa, the Houthis said.

articles.title: Lisa Cook standing up for the Federal Reserve is a ploy to turn a blind eye from her mortgage scandal - New York Post
articles.description: Fed Governor Lisa Cook is standing up to Donald Trump, suing to keep her job because she says the president is trumping up a scandal and she’s fighting for Fed independence.

articles.title: Musicians show support for longtime Utah violinist detained by ICE - NPR
articles.description: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement arrested John Shin, who has played with the Utah Symphony and Ballet West. The Department of Homeland Security cited his 2019 DUI conviction as the reason.

articles.title: Washed Clean: FSU sets the tone, announces itself to national audience with upset win over Alabama - 247Sports
articles.description: The rain came as Florida State began to believe

articles.title: Ruling on Trump’s tariffs is a major setback for the White House - The Washington Post
articles.description: An appellate court ruling could stymie the import taxes that Trump has used to raise revenue, negotiate with foreign leaders and even head off global conflicts.

articles.title: Chicago mayor signs order to resist potential Trump crackdown - BBC
articles.description: The order is the latest chapter in an escalating feud between the White House and Illinois state officials over violent crime and immigration.

articles.title: Full of expectations, Arch Manning struggles as top-ranked Texas falls at No. 3 Ohio State - AP News
articles.description: Arch Manning struggled under the weight of heady expectations for three quarters against Ohio State. He nearly led Texas back in the fourth quarter, but it wasn’t enough as the Longhorns lost to the third-ranked Buckeyes 14-7. Manning accounted for 208 yards …

articles.title: Frankenstein: Guillermo del Toro's Netflix adaptation debuts in Venice - BBC
articles.description: Saltburn star Jacob Elordi is unrecognisable as Frankenstein's creation in the new Netflix adaptation.

articles.title: Micah Parsons Trade Fallout: Financials, Cowboys, Packers - NFL Rumors - ProFootballRumors.com
articles.description: We now have some financial details for the contract of new Packers pass rusher Micah Parsons following his trade from Dallas...

articles.title: Rural America is suffering an economic crisis as crop prices plunge - Fortune
articles.description: "Prices continue to drop and at the same time our farmers are paying significantly more for inputs and equipment."

articles.title: Trump’s ‘Startling’ Rapid Deportation Policy Paused By US Judge - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: A US judge blocked a Trump administration policy that for months has allowed federal agents to rapidly remove undocumented immigrants without due process from anywhere in the US if they can’t quickly prove they’ve been in the country for more than two years.

articles.title: Robin Westman displayed signs of self-harm at prep school, former teacher said - NBC News
articles.description: An art teacher who had the Annunciation Catholic Church shooter in her class in 2017 said she saw signs of self-harm on her then-student

articles.title: Shrinking post-Katrina levees need $1B in upgrades - Politico
articles.description: Twenty years out from the New Orleans disaster, the city's levee and flood wall system must be raised or the region could become ineligible for federal flood insurance.

articles.title: Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy again but vows to keep flying - KSL.com
articles.description: Budget carrier Spirit Airlines said Friday that it has filed for fresh bankruptcy protection months after emerging from a Chapter 11 reorganization.
